snippet: In a case that should have been settled long ago, the M.T.A. has agreed to end its discriminatory uniform policy that targeted Sikh and Muslim employees.
abstract: Editorial observes that the Metropolitan Transportation Authority has settled a discrimination lawsuit brought by the Justice Department over the agency's treatment of Sikh and Muslim employees in the wake of the 9/11 attacks; criticizes the MTA for dragging things out so long, which has deepened the sense of injury in the Sikh and Muslim communities.
lead_paragraph: In a case that should have been settled long ago, the M.T.A. has agreed to end its discriminatory uniform policy that targeted Sikh and Muslim employees.
